Are you sure you don't have a corrupted zip file?

We should handle the ZipException.

A JavaModelException wrapping the ZipException is correctly thrown by
JavaElement#getChildren(). This exception is caught and logged by
PackageFragmentProvider#getChildren(Object).

Moving to JDT UI for comments

I don't think there's much more we can do. Can't show a dialog in getContents.
We could show a error node giving the error status.
PackageFragmentProvider just returns no children in this case. That's the best we can do with an invalid zip file.
